balanceValidator.title: Balance Validator
balanceValidator.helpOverviewDesc: The Balance Validator analyzes DPS (Damage Per Second) and EHP (Effective HP) to verify if units are balanced for their roles.

balanceValidator.helpStep3: Enter stats: Input HP, ATK, DEF, Attack Speed, Crit Rate, Crit Damage.

balanceValidator.helpDpsDesc: High damage to eliminate enemies quickly

balanceValidator.helpTip1: Units of the same role should have similar DPS/EHP
balanceValidator.helpTip2: Tank vs DPS should have ~50% win rate
balanceValidator.helpTip3: Total Value = (DPS% + EHP%) / 2 should be similar
balanceValidator.helpTip4: Std Dev under 15% indicates good overall balance

balanceValidator.tooltipVsSim: vs Combat Sim: Sim is actual combat, Validator is stat suitability

difficultyCurve.helpBalancedDesc: Equal growth, Appropriate challenge, Walls every 10 stages
difficultyCurve.helpHardcoreDesc: Player growth ↓, Enemy growth ↑, Frequent walls
difficultyCurve.helpGraphDesc: Blue bar higher than red = easy section, Red higher = difficult section (wall).

difficultyCurve.helpMilestonePowerDesc: Player power increase on content unlock (helps break walls)

references.title: Reference Guide & Recommended Values
references.subtitle: Game design theory and practical guidelines
references.legendDescription: Values below are guidelines based on industry standards and successful case studies. Adjust according to your game's characteristics.
references.footerNote: Values are for reference only. Adjust based on your game's genre and target audience.

theory.flowDesc: Difficulty-skill balance curve for optimal game experience. Design to keep players in a flow state between boredom and anxiety.
theory.schreiberDesc: Online course systematically covering mathematical approaches to game balance. Covers probability, growth curves, economy systems.
theory.mdaDesc: Mechanics, Dynamics, Aesthetics - Core game design framework that forms the basis of balance design.
theory.perfectImbalanceDesc: Why imbalanced design creates balanced play - Rock-paper-scissors relationships and metagame design.
theory.perfectImbalanceMetaValue: Replay value through continuous strategy discovery

damage.formulaDesc: Analysis of damage formula patterns like ATK - DEF, ATK × (100 / (100 + DEF)), ATK × (1 - DEF%) and their characteristics.
damage.ttkDesc: Weapon/skill balancing through Time To Kill and Damage Per Second calculations. Provides appropriate TTK standards by genre.
damage.ehpDesc: Effective health calculation combining defense, evasion, and damage reduction. Used for tank vs dealer balance.
damage.armorPenDesc: LoL/Dota style armor penetration system. Applied in order: % reduction → flat reduction → % penetration → flat penetration.
damage.armorPenOrderValue: % red → flat red → % pen → flat pen
damage.defTypeDesc: Defense formula selection by game genre. Each formula has different scaling characteristics.
damage.defTypeSubtractValue: ATK - DEF - simple, hard to scale

growth.linearDesc: y = base + (level × increment). Predictable and intuitive growth. Strong early, weak late characteristics.
growth.expDesc: y = base × ratio^level. Rapid late game growth. Watch for power inflation.
growth.logDesc: y = base + (multiplier × log(level)). Diminishing returns effect. Fast early, slow late.
growth.sCurveDesc: Slow early → rapid mid → converging late. Natural growth pattern adopted by many games.

economy.faucetSinkDesc: Design resource inflow (Faucet) and outflow (Sink) to prevent inflation and maintain healthy economy.
economy.currencyDesc: Multi-layer currency structure design (gold-diamond-premium). Separate acquisition difficulty and usage for each currency.
economy.timeMoneyDesc: Balance point design between F2P time investment and paying users' monetary investment.

gacha.pityDesc: Pity system - guaranteed acquisition after certain failures. Design considering expected value and user psychology.
gacha.softHardDesc: Combination of soft pity (gradual rate increase) and hard pity (100% guarantee) for finer probability control.
gacha.rateDesc: Base probability design by rarity. Probability distribution based on rarity and value.
gacha.expectedDesc: Calculate expected attempts to goal. Uses formula: 1-(1-p)^n = target probability.

stage.scalingDesc: Enemy strengthening design per stage/wave. Difficulty curve and reward balance.
stage.rewardDesc: Reward increase rate design per stage. Progression motivation and inflation prevention.
stage.restDesc: Relaxation zones after difficulty spikes. Player fatigue management.

linear.name: Linear
linear.desc: Same increase per level. Predictable and intuitive.
linear.useCase: Casual games, beginner-friendly balance. Same stat increase from level 1→50.

exponential.name: Exponential
exponential.desc: Rapid increase at higher levels. Hardcore late-game feel.

logarithmic.name: Logarithmic
logarithmic.desc: Fast early growth, slows down later.
logarithmic.useCase: Reduce level gap, catch-up systems. Keep stat difference small between high levels.

quadratic.name: Quadratic

linearHelp.name: Linear

exponentialHelp.desc: Explosive late-game increase. Idle/clicker games, XP tables, enhancement costs.

curves.linearDesc: y = ax + b. Constant rate of increase/decrease. Fixed stat gain per level, distance-based damage falloff, etc.
curves.quadraticDesc: y = ax² + bx + c. Accelerating growth. Slow early → steep late. XP requirements, late-game upgrade costs, etc.
curves.cubicDesc: y = ax³ + bx² + cx + d. Can represent S-curves. Slow start → rapid mid-growth → gradual late-game.
curves.powerDesc: y = ax^b. Growth rate controlled by exponent. b<1 for diminishing returns, b>1 for accelerating growth. Common in RPG damage formulas.
curves.exponentialDesc: y = a·e^(bx). Explosive growth/decay. Compound effects, inflation, cooldown reduction rates, etc.
curves.logarithmicDesc: y = a·ln(x) + b. Fast early growth → slow late (diminishing returns). Upgrade efficiency, skill mastery, etc.
curves.sigmoidDesc: y = L/(1+e^(-k(x-x₀))). Smooth transition between min and max values. Probability curves, difficulty scaling, level-capped stats, etc.

curveFitting.addPointsHint: Add at least 2 points to fit curves
